text: Does the second bullet under "Common issues" solve this for you? <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-cms-vscode#common-issues>
<@U26B530N6> Hi! This is exactly what im looking for, thanks alot, only thing that seems missing now is the auto closing of tags when not using emmet, any idea for that one?
perhaps also a setting similar to the emmet one :thinking_face:
hmmm, I'm not too sure. I didn't realize that broken with emmet but I will try to take a look
It didnt break with emmet, i didnt have it at all, also not before adding it to emmet
this is done correctly right? haha, just eliminating the first possible cause as maybe i’ve missed a small detail or something
Oh man, this was a year ago. I know I resolved it but can’t quite remember what fixed it. I think it was the actual command was wrong in some way.
Can you try removing the colons from the “item” key? So it looks more like this:
unfortunately that did not solve it :disappointed:
putting them in quotes as shown by the tooltip above also does not help
Yeah I think quotes wouldn’t be needed. After removing the colon can you try restarting VS Code?
done that, but with same results
Are you able to manually switch the language for a file?
yeah! and it works with normal html

The only thing I can think of is that maybe there is another configuration that’s overriding this one. Might be worth looking at the different layers of settings (User vs Workspace) to see if there’s something conflicting
yeah i could give that a shot, as far as im aware i did however not tweak anything besides the files.associations but yeah i can give that a shot and let you know if i managed to fix it
:+1: it could also be an extension that’s causing it too
